abstract: The bank’s expansionism under its former chief has made investors wary.
snippet: The bank’s expansionism under its former chief has made investors wary.
lead_paragraph: The ghost of the former chief executive Ken Lewis keeps haunting Bank of America. Since he resigned almost a year ago, the Charlotte-based bank has made progress. Yet its stock has fallen 37 percent from this year’s high, more than rivals, and now trades at a whopping 42 percent discount to last quarter’s book value.

byline.original: By ANTONY CURRIE and JEFFREY GOLDFARB

abstract: Can one bank bring down a country? Anglo Irish Bank, the midsize Irish lender whose profligacy has come to symbolize the excesses of the real estate bubble here, is doing its best to find out.
snippet: Can one bank bring down a country? Anglo Irish Bank, the midsize Irish lender whose profligacy has come to symbolize the excesses of the real estate bubble here, is doing its best to find out.
lead_paragraph: Can one bank bring down a country?

headline.main: Support of Anglo Irish Bank Strains Ireland

abstract: The ghost of the former chief executive Ken Lewis keeps haunting Bank of America. Since he resigned almost a year ago, it has made progress. Yet its stock has fallen 37 percent from this year’s high.
snippet: The ghost of the former chief executive Ken Lewis keeps haunting Bank of America. Since he resigned almost a year ago, it has made progress. Yet its stock has fallen 37 percent from this year’s high.

abstract: August’s unseasonable burst of dealmaking — the busiest in over a decade — could herald a wider rebound in M&A for the remainder of the year as low interest rates, record cash piles and low stock-market values encourage chief executives to strike deals, Reuters writes.

headline.main: Bidding Wars and No Holidays See M&A Pickup
